meanings.definition: A person who builds and repairs ships.
meanings.sent1: The skilled shipwrights worked diligently on the new vessel.
meanings.sent2: The shipwrights in the harbor were busy fixing a broken mast.
meanings.sent3: The shipwrights decided to have a race to see who could build a model ship the fastest.
meanings.sent4: The shipwrights were the architects of the sea, crafting vessels that danced on the waves.
meanings.sent5: The shipwrights' hands were calloused from shaping wood into majestic ships.

meanings.definition: The profession or trade of building and repairing ships.
meanings.sent1: Shipwrights require a deep understanding of naval architecture.
meanings.sent2: The history of shipwrights dates back centuries to the early days of sailing.
meanings.sent3: The shipwrights' union held a conference to discuss new techniques in shipbuilding.
meanings.sent4: In the world of shipwrights, innovation and tradition go hand in hand.
meanings.sent5: The shipwrights' guild was renowned for producing seaworthy vessels.
